document.docAuthor: Ishikawa, Tadashi, Susila, Wayan & Okajima, Shûji
document.docTitle: Ploiaria stysi Ishikawa, Susila & Okajima, 2008, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the emesine assassin bug genus Ploiaria (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from Indonesia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the emesine assassin bug genus Ploiaria (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from Indonesia

heading.emphasis:
Ploiaria stysi
Ishikawa & Okajima, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Indonesia , Bali , Tabanan, near Wangaya, Pura Jero Sasah.

Type material.
HOLOTYPE : J ( Figs. 1-3 , 7-12 , 19-22 ), ‘[INDONESIA] / Pura Jero Sasah , near / Wangaya , Tabanan , Bali , / 8˚22′09″S, 115˚06′25″E, / ca
900m
alt., /

.

Description. Measurements (mm, J / ♀ , holotype in parentheses). Body length – 12.5-14.7 / 14.0-16.0 (14.1). Head length – 1.10-12.3 / 1.19-1.24 (1.12), width across eyes – 0.66-0.74

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 13-18 –
Ploiaria paveli
sp. nov. , male (holotype). 13 – protibia and protarsus; 14 – profemur; 15 – apical part of mesofemur; 16 – basal part of mesotibia; 17 – apical part of metafemur; 18 – basal part of metatibia. Scale bars = 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pronotum ( Figs. 19-20 ) 3.8 times as long as humeral width, divided vaguely into anterior and posterior lobes at posterior tenth, roundly tumid on each anterolateral angle, with weakly concave posterior margin; posterior lobe ( Fig. 19 ) weakly rugose transversely. Mesonotum (excluding scutellum) 0.6 times as long as pronotum, 1.9 times as long as its maximum width. Hemelytra slightly exceeding anterior margin of abdominal tergite VI; venation as in Fig. 23 .

Differential diagnosis. In general appearance,
Ploiaria stysi
sp. nov. resembles
P . maai Wygodzinsky, 1966
, described from the Bismarck Islands; for distinguishing characters see Table 1.

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 19-23.
Ploiaria stysi
sp. nov. ; setae omitted except for spine-like setae in 21 and 22. 19-20 – head and pronotum: 19 – dorsal view, 20 – lateral view; 21 – left fore leg; 22 – basal part of profemur, ventrolateral view; 23 – right hemelytron. Abbreviation: bss = basal spine-like seta. Scale bars = 1.0 mm.

Figs. 24-31.
Ploiaria stysi
sp. nov. ; setae omitted in 24, 25 and 30. 24-25 – pygophore: 24 – lateral view, 25 – ventral view; 26-27 – left paramere: 26 – lateral view, 27 – dorsal view; 28 – phallus, lateral view; 29 – basal plate of phallus, dorsal view; 30 – left valvifer I and valvula I, lateral view; 31 – styloids, dorsal view. Abbreviations. ans = apically narrowed sclerotized area; bp = basal plate; bpb = basal plate bridge; fp = foliaceous projection; lsp = laterally sclerotized posterior process; vf1 = valvifer I; vl1 = valvula I. Scale bars = 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. This species name is dedicated to Prof. Pavel Štys to celebrate his 75th birthday.

Biology.
Ploiaria stysi
sp. nov. was collected from ferns growing along forest passes by netsweeping. It was often observed to fly actively in order to escape out of a sweep net. Although the life cycle has not been surveyed, adults and nymphs of this species were abundant at all collecting sites on both Bali and Flores in March, August, September and November.

Distribution.
Ploiaria stysi
sp. nov. is known from Bali and Flores , Indonesia .
